Package com.littlesaints.protean.functions.streams

Class If<T,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.littlesaints.protean.functions.streams.If<T,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The input type.
    R - The return type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<T,java.util.Optional<R>>
    public class If<T,R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Function<T,java.util.Optional<R>>
     This is a functional substitute for an 'if-else' construct as a lambda, especially when using java streams.

 The function returns an Optional of the return Type, since there can be cases where there are no matching conditions provided to map a value.
 e.g. Configuring an 'if' condition without an else.

 Usage:

 
 IntStream.range(-10, 10).boxed()
      .map(i -> {
          if (i > 0) {
              return "positive";
          } else {
              return "negative";
          }})
      .forEach(System.out::println);
 

 can be written as:

 
 IntStream.range(-10, 10).boxed()
     .map(
          If.<Integer, String>test(i -> i > 0)
          .then(i -> "positive")
          .orElse(i -> "negative"))
     .forEach(System.out::println);
 

 Note:
 - The use of 'elseif' construct is also supported.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Switch
